decision_conditions: The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): DR-001 Eastern Access Site Location Plan; C.1162 AL (0) 02C PROPOSED BLOCK PLAN; C.1162 AL (0) 03C PROPOSED PADEL COURT ARRANGEMENTS; C.1162 AL (0) 04C PROPOSED ELEVATIONS; Padel Tennis Noise Assessment RP01-24238-R2; Design and Access Statement for Padel Courts at The Green Quarter
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The use of the pedal courts shall be constructed in accordance with the noise mitigation measures, including absorption to surfaces to mitigate against ball impacts and players' voices, and to ensure that the cumulative activity noise level does not exceed the noise limits for noise sensitive premises, as specified in BS8233:2014 and in the report by Cass Allen ref. RP01-24238-R2 dated 29 April 2024.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| The padel courts shall not be used other than between the hours of 07:00 to 23:00.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from activities or people attending the site, in accordance with Policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The external artificial lighting shall be in accordance with the requirement of Environmental Zone 3 of the Institution of Lighting Professionals in the 'Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light'. Lighting shall be installed to prevent glare and sky glow by sufficiently opaque and appropriate colour, locating, aiming and shielding luminaires.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of residents in accordance with policies D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
description: Temporary planning consent for a period of 15-years covering installation of three Padel courts, floodlights, polycarbonate canopy, hoarding, change to use class F2, ancillary storage container and associated hard & soft landscaping (retrospective)
